Headline: Co-Founder, Finroles | CA | SRCC | StanChart | EY
Comment:
Dilip this reminds me of Varghese Kurien, the legend who fought against bureaucracy for 3 years to introduce bulk vending.

Sharing an interesting story here - to implement Operation Flood successfully, Kurien wanted to import ~200 machines for Rs. 1.5 crore. However, this proposition was not passed by the government.

What does the man do? Builds his own vending machines in India with coins that work perfectly. Mind you, this is a time when coins wouldnâ€™t always work in public telephone booths.

Headline: Strategic Partnerships (Healthcare + D2C) | Brand & GTM Operator | Building Clean Snacking on the Side
Comment:
I feel like I might be older, or perhaps my city didn't have milk vending machines back in the day. We used to go to a dairy farmer's house, where they lived in a community, and every morning, fresh milk was brought directly from the cow. The dairy farmer would pour the amount we needed into our cans.

It wasn't until 2015, when I moved to Delhi for work, that I saw a Mother Dairy vending machine for the first time.
